skill.name: citation-management
skill.description: Comprehensive citation management for academic research. Search Google Scholar and PubMed for papers, extract accurate metadata, validate citations, and generate properly formatted BibTeX entries. This skill should be used when you need to find papers, verify citation information, convert DOIs to BibTeX, or ensure reference accuracy in scientific writing.
skill.summary: Comprehensive citation management for academic research. Search Google Scholar and PubMed for papers...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: Legitimate academic citation management tool. Static analysis produced 1131 false positives by misinterpreting markdown code blocks as shell commands, list comprehensions as obfuscation, and documentation as network reconnaissance. Actual Python scripts make authorized API calls to public academic databases (CrossRef, PubMed, arXiv) for metadata retrieval.

content.value_statement: This skill helps researchers find papers, extract metadata, and generate properly formatted BibTeX entries. It validates existing citations and ensures reference accuracy for scientific writing and publication.
actual_capabilities: Search Google Scholar and PubMed for academic papers
Extract metadata from DOI, PMID, arXiv ID, or URL
Convert identifiers to properly formatted BibTeX entries
Validate citation accuracy and detect duplicates
Format and clean existing BibTeX files
Verify DOIs resolve correctly via CrossRef API
limitations: Requires internet access for API queries to academic databases
Google Scholar search may be rate-limited without authentication
Cannot access papers behind paywalls directly
arXiv API only covers preprints, not published versions

use_cases.title: Build bibliography for manuscript
use_cases.description: Search databases, extract metadata, and generate citation-ready BibTeX entries for thesis or paper.

use_cases.title: Literature review citation tracking
use_cases.description: Find and organize citations for literature review while maintaining consistent formatting.

use_cases.title: Validate existing references
use_cases.description: Check BibTeX files for errors, broken DOIs, and duplicate entries before manuscript submission.

prompt_templates.title: Basic DOI conversion
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert this DOI to a properly formatted BibTeX entry: 10.1038/s41586-021-03819-2

prompt_templates.title: Search academic database
prompt_templates.prompt: Search PubMed for recent papers on CRISPR gene editing published since 2020. Extract metadata and generate BibTeX entries.

prompt_templates.title: Validate bibliography
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my BibTeX file at references.bib. Check for missing fields, broken DOIs, and duplicates. Report any issues found.

prompt_templates.title: Batch metadata extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract metadata from this list of DOIs and PMIDs and save them to a formatted BibTeX file.

output_examples.input: Search for papers on machine learning protein folding
output: - Author2023, 'Deep Learning for Protein Structure Prediction', Nature Methods
- Author2024, 'Machine Learning in Structural Biology', Cell
Extracted metadata and generated BibTeX entries saved to ml_proteins.bib

best_practices: Always verify extracted metadata against the original publication for accuracy
Use DOIs as primary identifiers for most reliable metadata retrieval
Validate complete bibliography before manuscript submission
Set appropriate rate limits when batch processing to avoid API throttling
anti_patterns: Manually typing BibTeX entries instead of using automated extraction
Ignoring validation warnings about missing required fields
Using inconsistent citation key naming conventions across files
Submitting manuscripts without running final citation validation

faq.question: What identifiers does this skill support?
faq.answer: DOI, PMID, arXiv ID, and article URLs are supported. DOI is preferred for best metadata quality.

faq.question: Which academic databases can be searched?
faq.answer: PubMed for biomedical literature and Google Scholar for cross-disciplinary academic search are available.

faq.question: Is an API key required?
faq.answer: NCBI API key is optional but recommended for PubMed to increase rate limits. Set via environment variable.

faq.question: What output formats are supported?
faq.answer: BibTeX and JSON formats are supported. BibTeX is the primary format for LaTeX document integration.

faq.question: Can this skill detect duplicate citations?
faq.answer: Yes, validation includes duplicate detection based on DOI, title similarity, and author-year combinations.

faq.question: How are special characters handled?
faq.answer: Special characters in author names and titles are properly escaped for BibTeX compatibility with LaTeX.
